reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Mystery, Thriller, Paranormal All Wrapped Up In One Wonderful Book
reviews.reviewText: Absolutely amazing 🤩 📕 Book. If I could give it more than 5 ⭐️ I would.I started this book with trepidation hoping it wasn’t TOO much of a thriller mystery. But with Stephen King saying he loved it 😍 you can’t quite be sure what you’re getting into!I have to say I wished I could’ve just read the whole thing at once. I didn’t want to put it down!The author does an amazing job of stringing you along with bits and pieces. He keeps the suspense going till the very end.It’s not often I read ‘suspense, thriller’ type books anymore because sometimes they’re just too realistic. When I was younger and didn’t know the woes of the world I love suspense, thriller, horror. So thank you for making the book not quite too dark!This is a must read! Thank you Kindle for pushing your readers into a few things with the reader achievements. This was a Goodreads Beat of the year book. Yes I realize you don’t have to get that achievement, but hey I like it!So one more time READ THIS BOOK.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I love the writing of Jason, its easy to get a hold of the characters, you get quickly involed into the story and even tho some of the chapters were abit longer it still felt like a easy read. All in all a great thriller from Jason. :)_________ Spoilers ___________I knew right away when she mentioned she was christian there would be some kind of demon/possesed aspects, that trope is pretty obvious. Also one of the reasons I cant give this a full 5 stars is because Teddy did not feel like a 5 year old, his language was way too grown up. Another aspect is that it feels icky to me to mention both J.K rowling and trans into one book. I dont think thats a great combo. But I will deifntly read something from Jason again.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Something Different & Original
reviews.reviewText: This is not just an entertaining read, it's quite original. Although the story contains many tropes of ghost stories, thrillers, etc it easily steps far beyond the box. The areas of story that often drag in other novels move along well, and keep the flow of the story moving forward. It is rare that I don't have a clue a twist is coming, but Mr. Rekulak succeeded employing a very unexpected twist. Hidden Pictures is entertaining., and well paced. The characters are well developed, the scenes are easy to imagine and work well with the story. A suspenseful read that does not forget the bones of a story.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Wow, this exceeded my expectations for sure. This sent me on a journey through all the emotions. I connected with this quite a bit since I have 2 young boys so I could put myself in this situation and it seriously gave me the creeps. The ending “twist” caught me by surprise for sure and I was shocked, then I ended up crying at the end. What a rollercoaster, I loved this and how the pictures are used throughout the book to really drive the point home!I ended up falling in love with the child in this book, such a sweet kid with a great imagination and really rooting for the FMC, despite her flaws and past issues. The story line has been done a ton in horror movies and books but had a great twist here that made it stand out and not feel redundant. The ending really felt realistic and was a great finish to the story. I am not always a thriller person as I feel they are usually predictable and all so similar but this one bordered more on the horror side and I think that’s why I liked it so much.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Check your triggers. Great book!
reviews.reviewText: Mallory is a recovering addict who just got a job as a nanny. Shorty after getting the job the boy who she's caring for, Teddy, starts drawing very concerning pictures and Mallory is concerned. She's convinced these drawings are clues to the unsolved murder that happened in her cabin in the early 1900s. She would never have imagined the truth she would uncover.I really enjoyed reading the book. I found Mallory's backstory quite intriguing and was curious to learn more about it. The unsolved murder in her cabin was also a fascinating mystery that captivated me throughout the book. The twist at the end caught me off guard and was quite mind-blowing. Although the ending left me feeling sad and empty, it was a realistic conclusion, even though I was hoping for a happy ending. I do wish there was more closure in the ending, such as finding out who finished 3rd in the race.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Normally it takes a lot to keep me concentrated on one thing for too long, especially when it comes to reading. However, Hidden Pictures kept me flipping through the pages wanting to know what will happen next. It was an incredible read and didn't take long to finish because I kept sitting down with the book. The ending surprised me, I wasn't expecting it but the ending had me on the edge until it ended, I had to finish the last bit without stopping.I definitely recommend this book if you love thrillers with a little bit of supernatural in it. I found it via Tiktok and was glad I looked more into it. I'll have to take a look at more of this author's work.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This is my first book by Mr Rekulak, but I can assure you it won’t be the last. I try to read 4 new authors a month. When I saw how many 5 star reviews it had I knew it must be special. It is so cleverly written that I found myself thinking, “just one more chapter and I’m going to bed”. I finally laid down at 5 am. The uniqueness of the story made it so enticing. What makes it flow with the suspense in the background like music in a movie is exceptional. It doesn’t have to knock you over the head with violence and gore. It has a life of its own. I love that it’s not obvious. You really don’t know what’s happening until it does. Anyone who reads this genre will totally enjoy this book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The perfect family with the perfect life…
reviews.reviewText: The audiobook was perfect, and so was the narrator! This book definitely lives up to the hype. I was not expecting the twists that came. Mallory is a recovering addict who gets hired on to be a nanny for a perfect family in a suburban town. Husband - Ted, Wife - Caroline, and son - Teddy. They know that she is in recovery, but they give her a chance. She ends up doing wonderful with Teddy and is in charge of helping him get ready to start school soon. But soon Teddy starts to draw some strange and disturbing pictures. Mallory gets caught up in trying to find out what the pictures mean, and she feels that the cottage she’s staying in, is haunted. Such a great read!!
I think this is one of my favourite books I’ve read in a while! So many interesting turns that happen in the end!! Woooow! Would reccomend!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Te lo acabas en una sentada
reviews.reviewText: Me encantó el libro, no pude dejar de leer, lo terminé en un día. Lo recomiendo si te gusta el suspenso.

The media could not be loaded. Ok, primeiramente a entrega foi espetacular! Chegou em uns 3/4 dias se não me engano, novinho, super bem embalado e como podem ver no vídeo e nas fotos é em inglês mesmo.Agora vamos para avaliação literária. Bem, na vdd eu li o e-book ano passado quando tinha lançado (eu li em junho e lançou em maio) e não tinha nenhuma ideia do que esperar. Geralmente não curto bastante o gênero suspense mas tava na pilha do Stranger Things que teria uma nova temporada e decidi dar uma chance pro autor que nunca tinha nem ouvido ninguém comentar antes. Gente… foi amor à primeira lida kkkk além de ser uma história ao mesmo tempo gostosa, com um ar de “verão suburbano estadunidense” também vai pegando embalo e criando aquele suspense ao passar dos capítulos que me deixou perdida nas páginas por horas! A personagem principal é bem escrita em minha opinião. O Rekulak conseguiu deixar ela bem humana, sem aqueles clichês horrorosos que deixam mulheres escritas por homens tão 2-dimensionais. A família é bastante interessante e as interações entre os personagens é perfeito pra quem gosta de psicanalisar relacionamentos interpessoais. E o reviravolta do final!! Perfeito de toda forma!Enfim acho que deu pra entender que eu sou fã desse livro.Podem comprar sem medo e aliás não me surpreenderia se essa história virasse filme logo logo.
What a beautiful story.. intriguingI loved the endingThe characters are so colorful.I expected some more action from Russel though. This wiuld definitely make a good movie.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 22, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I can usually always sus out the plot twist but this one I didn't know what to expect! This was brilliant and one of the best books I've read in a while.
